title: Creating an Inequality
text: First, we must translate the word problem into an inequality that represents the number of boxes one pallet can support.

title: Creating an Inequality
text: Since we know that the boxes weight $$45$$ pounds each, and they cannot weigh more than $$900$$ pounds in total, let's let $$n$$ equal the number of boxes. Now, we have the inequality $$45n \leq 900$$.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: Now, we must isolate the variable $$n$$ in order to calculate the maximum number of boxes a pallet can support.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To isolate $$n$$, we must divide both sides by 45; we now have $$n \leq 20$$.

title: Creating a Sentence-Answer
text: Since we know that $$n$$ must be less than or equal to $$20$$, what is the maximum number of boxes one pallet can support?
